intro: Neobartlettia hylobia, commonly known as the pink-flowered spurge, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse floral structures. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by colorful bracts, giving it a striking visual appearance. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a waxy texture. Neobartlettia hylobia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
